alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Elk; McKean; Potter; Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 8:16PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Cameron, Elk, McKean, Potter and Warren. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 814 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated that an area of heavy rain was moving across northwestern Pennsylvania late this evening. Rainfall so far today of 2 to 3 inches has been observed, and an additional 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain is possible late this evening. - Some locations that could experience minor flooding include... St. Marys, Warren, Bradford, Ridgway, Kane, Johnsonburg, Cameron, Port Allegany, Sheffield, Emporium, Smethport, Wetmore, Russell, Roulette, Shinglehouse, Betula, Wilcox, James City, Force and Benezette. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
